ETYMOLOGY: From Arabic zarāfa ('assemblage, troop', also 'giraffe', perhaps from an African language), via Old French girafle or Italian giraffa.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A very tall African mammal with a very long neck and legs, a coat with brown patches, and small, horn-like projections on its head.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种产于非洲的非常高的哺乳动物，颈和腿都非常长，皮毛有棕色斑块，头上长有小而角状的突起。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The children were amazed by the height of the giraffe at the zoo.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 孩子们被动物园里长颈鹿的高度惊呆了。
